definition: to be in command/(fig.) to dominate over other considerations/to be given overemphasis

to hang or suspend (from a hook etc)/to hang up (the phone)/(of a line) to be dead/to be worried or concerned/to make a phone call (dialect)/to register or record/classifier for sets or clusters of objects/(slang) to kill/to die/to be finished/to fail (an exam)
preoccupied with school grades/overemphasis on test scores
caring only about money and wealth

sentences.english: American drama is economic -oriented but it treats Shakespeare's plays with a cultural outlook.
sentences.chinese: 美國戲劇是經濟掛帥的，但對莎劇卻頗有文化的眼光。

sentences.english: The new managing director will act as spearhead of the campaign.
sentences.chinese: 新上任的常務董事將在這場運動中掛帥。

sentences.english: Money talks here, demons walk here, ain't there any love around here?
sentences.chinese: 金錢掛帥，罪惡當道，難道這裏沒有愛存在嗎？
